meanings.definition: To decorate or inscribe with prominent symbols or designs.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed emblazoning her notebook with colorful stickers.
meanings.sent2: The knight's shield was emblazoning with a fierce dragon.
meanings.sent3: The artist had a habit of emblazoning everything in sight with glitter.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like emblazoning sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks emblazoning the night sky left everyone in awe.

meanings.sent1: The store window was emblazoning with the latest fashion trends.
meanings.sent2: The banner emblazoning the entrance welcomed guests to the event.
meanings.sent3: The cat enjoyed emblazoning its presence by sitting on the highest shelf.
meanings.sent4: His words were like emblazoning declarations of love for her.
meanings.sent5: The neon sign emblazoning the street corner attracted many customers.

meanings.definition: The act of adorning or displaying something prominently.
meanings.sent1: The emblazoning of the trophy made it stand out among the other awards.
meanings.sent2: Her emblazoning of the room with fairy lights created a magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The emblazoning of the cake with candles made it look festive.
meanings.sent4: The emblazoning of the stage with flowers added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent5: The emblazoning of the banner with the team logo showed their pride.
